pr_title: Add rest percentage check to monitor

timeline.message:
Add rest percentage check to monitor

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Refactor and add test

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: It shouldn't be greater than 1. So @Min(0) @Max(1) would be better.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Makes sense, I hesitated when I noticed the documentation said doubles aren't supported, but it's working as expected and has been changed.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText:
Percentage is grammatically used for general measurements and not specific values. We should use percent instead.
But really what we're doing here is sampling. Generally that's measured in total sample size or sample rate/frequency. Ours is a sample percentage of the transaction rate. So we should either name it sampleRate or samplePercent to make clear it's a percentage.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: We should have tests for 100% and for a percent in between with a large enough sample size. See ConfigurableTransactionGeneratorTest for an example.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Added tests for 100% and 75%, and reworked all 3 tests to run 1000 responses.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.bodyText: Avoid the property reflection penalty by getting the percent once outside the flux as a primitive.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
